page.title: 09Education
page.content: First record of a school being in village was 1872.School was held in two low and small cottage rooms very draughty and very unsuitable and a new school was urgently needed.The first head mistress was Miss Ball.The lessons were very different from today.There were forty three children in school.It was know as C.K.National School. "In 1873 a new and pretty school has been built since my last visit and is now occupied by hundred and sixty children!".This was written in the Log book by Miss Marie Chichester school correspondent.Very few children attended school in the winter of 1873 because the weather was so bad and many children were ill. {1900 H.M.I report.The school continies in a thoroughly effecient
